definition: to raise a loan/to borrow money
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Everything else will require more borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 其他开支都得靠更多举债来维持。

sentences.english: Deflation can be avoided through debt and money printing.
sentences.chinese: 通过举债和印制钞票可以防止通缩。

sentences.english: Eventually, we have to get off this binge of borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我们还是要摆脱这种过度举债。

sentences.english: She was broke, in debt, and had to start over.
sentences.chinese: 结果她破产了，举债度日，只好重新开始。

sentences.english: He is in debt every year;
sentences.chinese: 他这个人年年举债，天天酒肉。

sentences.english: So what does government borrowing do?
Italy or Spain might become unable to borrow on decent terms.
sentences.chinese: 意大利或西班牙可能无法按照公平条款举债。

definition: to be in debt/to incur debts/liability (finance)
lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt
financial leverage/leveraging (i.e. buying shares on borrowed funds)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to owe a debt/the sum owed
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
